intro: Comostemum prolixum, commonly known as the long-stemmed comostemum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals, and are borne in terminal clusters. Comostemum prolixum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
